content.question: ​Which of the following functions has a zero at <math alttext="x equals 3"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and has a graph in the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane with a vertical asymptote at <math alttext="x equals 2"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and a hole at <math alttext="x equals 1"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator x squared minus 4 x plus 3 over denominator x squared minus 3 x plus 2 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator x squared minus 5 x plus 6 over denominator x squared minus 3 x plus 2 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>j</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator x minus 3 over denominator x squared minus 3 x plus 2 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="m open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator x minus 3 over denominator x squared minus 4 x plus 3 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>m</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator x squared minus 4 x plus 3 over denominator x squared minus 3 x plus 2 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 1.11: Equivalent Representations of Polynomial and Rational Expressions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
